starwars

Class SWAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Action
      • starwars.SWAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionInterface, java.lang.Comparable<ActionInterface>, SWActionInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Move

    public abstract class SWAction
extends Action
implements SWActionInterface
    Base class for all intransitive commands/Actions in the starwars world. This class is an implementation of the SWActionInterface
    Author:
    ram
    See Also:
    Action, SWActionInterface

    • Method Detail

      • isMoveCommand

        public boolean isMoveCommand()
        Returns if or not this SWAction is a move command. By default, SWActions are not move commands hence this method will always return false.

        This method needs to be overridden in any SWAction is a move command (i.e. must be overridden to return true if the action can potentially change the location of a SWEntity or SWActor).

        Specified by:
        isMoveCommand in interface SWActionInterface
        Returns:
        false

      • execute

        public void execute(Actor<?> a)
        Execute this SWAction by calling the act() method with an Actor a to perform the SWAction.

        This method acts as a wrapper for the act() method that downcasts its parameter to minimize dangerous downcasting in subclasses.

        This method only calls the act() method if and only,

        • The sub class of Actor a is a SWActor, and
        • The SWActor is not dead
        else this method does nothing.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface ActionInterface
        Specified by:
        execute in class Action
        Parameters:
        a - a sub class of Actor
        See Also:
        act(SWActor), SWActor.isDead()

      • act

        public abstract void act(SWActor a)
        Description copied from interface: SWActionInterface
        The method that defines what needs to be performed when this action is performed.
        Specified by:
        act in interface SWActionInterface
        Parameters:
        a - the SWActor who performs this action.
